description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (Amendments to approved drawings) and condition 3 (Amendments to approved materials) in relation to planning permission reference 201967FUL dated 09/06/2021 for Construction of a three storey building , with basement level and habitable loft space, to accommodate 9 self-contained flats (following demolition of existing dwelling house) and provision of associated amenity spaces, parking spaces, cycle storage and refuse storage facilities
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from 9 June 2021.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (As Amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawing titles: 20-021-P01 Revision A dated 02/09/2020; Site Plan 5761-1112 Rev B; Ground Floor Plan 5761-1261 Rev D; Basement Plan 5761-1260 Rev C; First Floor Plan 5761-1262 Rev D; Second Floor Plan 5761-1263 Rev D; Third Floor Plan 5761-1264 Rev D; Roof Plan 5761-1264 Rev B; Front Rear Elevations 5761-1314 Rev E; SE Elevation 5761-1315 Rev D; NW Elevation 5761-1316 Rev D; Materials 5761-M-1000 Rev E, Planning Amendments list by pwp architects (23 November 2023), Street elevation 5761-1320, Planning, Design & Access Statement (dated January 2021); UA/LP1 (dated 21/04/2020); UA/LP2 (dated 21/04/2020); UA/LP3 (dated 28/04/2020); UA/LP4 (dated 28/04/2020); UA/LP5 (dated 28/04/2020); Tree Survey, Impact Assessment, Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan (dated 11/05/2020); Daylight and Sunlight Study by Base Energy (May 2020); BS 5837:2012 Tree Survey, Impact Assessment, Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan (11 October 2021), BS 5837:2012 Addendum to Tree Survey, Impact Assessment, Method Statement and Tree Protection Plan (28 November 2021).
Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The materials and finishes to be used for all external surfaces of the building shall be as specified by approved plan 5761-M-1000 Rev E of this permission and the development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes are of high quality and contribute positively to the visual amenity of the locality in accordance with policies 1.1 (h) (g), 1.2(h), 2.1(c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The development shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the details of the secure cycle parking facilities approved under Ref: 234803CND dated 22.01.2024. These cycle parking facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted and shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Ealing Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the details of the design and operation of the facilities for the storage and removal of refuse from the premises approved under Ref: 234948CND  dated 15.01.2024 and such facilities shall be provided before the building is first occupied.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with the Ealing Council's Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers, as well as policies SI 8 of the London Plan (2021), 1.1 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 3.5, 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | The development shall be implemented strictly in accordance with the approved Demolition Method Statement and Construction Management Plan Ref: 234949CND dated 25.01.2024 for the duration of these demolition and construction works.

Reason: To ensure appropriate mitigation measures to protect the amenity of local residents and ensure adequate highway and site safety in accordance with policies D14, SI1, T4 and T7 of the London Plan (2021); 1.1(e)(j) and 2.1(c) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy

(2012); 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013); the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006); and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on
construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise.

| Prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved, works to provide the hard and soft landscaping (incl. trees, shrubs and plants) shown on the Landscape Plans (UA/LP1 (dated 21/04/2020); UA/LP2 (dated 21/04/2020); UA/LP3 (dated 28/04/2020); UA/LP4 (dated 28/04/2020); UA/LP5 (dated 28/04/2020)) shall be carried out in full, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority, and maintained permanently. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season and maintained permanently.

Reason: In the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the local area, ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, and providing sustainable urban drainage in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7A, 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained on the hereby approved plans listed in Condition 2 or the submitted Tree Survey (dated 11/05/2020) shall be felled, uprooted, wilfully damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Any trees removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced in accordance with trees, shrubs or hedge plants of similar size and species unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

Reason: In the interests of ensuring suitable amenity spaces are provided for future occupants, providing sustainable urban drainage, and protecting the visual amenity of the local area and privacy of habitable rooms within the development in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); and 5.10, 7A, 7B, 7.3 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Class L of Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (As Amended) (or any subsequent order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modifications), the proposed self-contained dwelling units (Use Class C3) shall not be used for a use falling within Class C4 (Houses in Multiple Occupation) of the Schedule to the Use Classes Order without prior approval of the Local Planning Authority obtained by the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the Council retains control over the quality, impacts and provision of any change of use and to safeguard amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties and living conditions of occupants of the development in accordance with the GLA's Supplementary Planning Guidance on Housing (2016) as well as Policy D3 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Development Management DPD. | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the approved drainage strategy and sustainable drainage mitigation techniques under permission Ref: 234951CND dated 24.01.2024 and these drainage measures shall be permanently maintained thereafter. No discharge of foul or surface water from the site shall be accepted into the public system until the drainage works referred to in the strategy have been implemented.

Reason: To reduce the risk of the flooding of the application property, neighbouring properties, and local area in accordance with policy SI13 of the London Plan (2021); policy 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); and 5.12 of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57/60 dB).  The sound insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building). The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy D3 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the details of the enhanced sound insulation, with a value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, to the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas as approved under Ref: 234953CND dated 9.01.2024.  The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Policies D3 and D14 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development shall be implemented in accordance with the Arboricultural Method Statement approved under permission Ref: 216406CND dated 23.02.2023.  All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| The development shall be implemented in accordance with the Tree Monitoring Program approved under permission Ref: 216406CND dated 23.02.2023.  Within three months of first use of the development hereby approved, a report containing the following details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
(a) Results of each site visit by the lead arboriculturist with photos attached.
(b) Assessment of the retained and planted trees including any necessary remedial action as a result of damage incurred during construction.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | A suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and pits shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the development hereby approved. No operations shall commence on site in connection with the development hereby approved until a suitable scheme of proposed tree planting and tree pits have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The scheme shall include the following comprehensive details of all trees to be planted:
o Full planting specification - tree size, species, the numbers of trees and any changes
from the original application proposals.
o Locations of all proposed species.
o Comprehensive details of ground/tree pit preparation to include:
o Plans detailing adequate soil volume provision to allow the tree to grow to maturity
o Engineering solutions to demonstrate the tree will not interfere with structures (e.g. root barriers/deflectors) in the future
o Staking/tying method(s).
o Five year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule.

All tree planting must be carried out in full accordance with the approved scheme in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive). The quality of all approved tree planting should be carried out to the levels detailed in British Standard 8545, Trees: from nursery to independence in the landscape - Recommendations.

Any trees which die, are removed, uprooted, significantly damaged, become diseased or malformed within five years from the completion of planting, must be replaced during the nearest planting season (1st October to 31st March inclusive) with a tree/s of the same size, species and quality as previously approved.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies G4, G6 and G7 of the London Plan (2021); policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | No operations (excluding site clearance and demolition) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until evidence confirming the demolition of the adjacent dwellinghouse No.24 Somerset Road has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To ensure that the built form sits comfortably within the character of the local area, in accordance with policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 1.1 (g), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012. | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the Piling Method Statement approved under permission Ref: 234957CND dated 5.03.2024.

Reason: The proposed works will be in close proximity to underground sewerage utility infrastructure. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out only in conjunction with the lawful implementation of planning permission 201966FUL as varied by permission 223822VAR for the "Construction of a three-storey building, with basement level and habitable loft space, to accommodate 8 self-contained flats (following demolition of existing dwelling house) and provision of associated amenity spaces, parking spaces, cycle storage and refuse storage facilities" at 24 Somerset Road W13 9PB.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the neighbouring site at number 24 Somerset Road are not adversely affected by the proposal, in accordance with polices D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
